results.title: Frida
results.creator_credit: Julie Taymor, Roberto Sneider, Lindsay Flickinger, Nancy Hardin, Lizz Speed, Joy Polstein, Salma Hayek, Sarah Green, Ventanarosa Productions and Miramax Films
results.brief_description: Academy Award winning biographical feature about Mexican artist Frida Kahlo. The story unfolds in splendid colour from Frida’s early years, as we watch Frida’s journey to become a recognised artist in her own right.

constellations_other.name: From gallery to screen
constellations_other.description: Explore how famous films, videogames and music videos have taken their cue from the art of the past.

results.creator_credit_for_label: Julie Taymor, Roberto Sneider, Lindsay Flickinger, Nancy Hardin, Lizz Speed, Joy Polstein, Salma Hayek, Sarah Green, Ventanarosa Productions and Miramax Films
results.description: Academy Award winning biographical feature about Mexican artist Frida Kahlo, played by Salma Hayek. The story unfolds in splendid colour from Frida’s early years and follows through to the moment of her death. We witness her struggles in life against traditional society’s perceptions of women, her own physical disabilities and most importantly, her struggle to become a recognised artist/painter in her own right. Cast includs Alfred Molina as Diego Rivera, Antonio Banderas, Valeria Golino, Ashley Judd, Mia Maestro, Edward Norton and Geoffrey Rush. Second disc contains many special features.
description_for_label: Academy Award winning biographical feature about Mexican artist Frida Kahlo, played by Salma Hayek. We witness her struggles in life against traditional society’s perceptions of women, her own physical disabilities and most importantly, her struggle to become a recognised artist/painter in her own right. Cast includs Alfred Molina as Diego Rivera, Antonio Banderas, Valeria Golino, Ashley Judd, Mia Maestro, Edward Norton and Geoffrey Rush. Second disc contains many special features.

results.title: Targets
results.creator_credit: Peter Bogdanovich, Saticoy and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: The first feature of Peter Bogdanovich combines two seemingly unrelated plots. Plot one follows the depressed retiring horror film actor (Boris Karloff) and his despairing of the real horror of 60’s America. Meanwhile a lone sniper picks off strangers after coldly killing his parents and a delivery boy. The disquieting plots meet after tenion builds at a drive-in cinema. A tense and disturbing film. Cast also include Tim O’Kelly, Nancy Hsueh and James Brown.

results.creator_credit: James Hanlon, Gedeon Naudet, Jules Naudet, Ian Paisley, Paul la Rosa, Silverstar Productions and Goldfish Pictures
results.brief_description: Two filmmaking brothers set out to make an documentary about the New York Fire Department following a trainee’s development to working at a fire station. The fire station they cover turns out to be one of the closest to the World Trade Centre and what evolves is the most gripping and terrifying footage of the terrorist attack on 9th September 2001. How this event affects the firemen, filmmakers and people of New York, is shown by a mixture of actual footage and interviews. Directed by Jules and Gedeon Naudet and James Hanlon. WARNING: SOME SCENES MAY DISTURB.

results.title: Treasure planet
results.creator_credit: Ron Clements, John Musker, Roy Conli and Walt Disney Pictures
results.brief_description: Walt Disney animated feature based on the novel “Treasure Island” by Robert Louis Stevenson. A dazzling mix with the feel of an old costumed pirate drama combined with space travel adventure. A small boy reads an animated adventure book about pirates on a quest for treasure, all set in space. The sea is replaced by space and the bad pirate is a cyborg, but the story of the personal growth of the young male protagonist is timeless.

results.title: The Spanish apartment = L'Auberge Espagnole
results.creator_credit: Cedric Klapisch, Bruno Levy, Ce Qui Me Meut and Fox Searchlight Pictures
results.brief_description: Written and directed by Cedric Klapisch, “The Spanish Apartment”, a French/Spanish co-production, investigates the issue of whether or not a job makes us who we really are. In the quest to find a steady job, Xavier (Romain Duris) heads off to Spain for a year of post-graduate study leaving his girlfriend (Audrey Tautou) and mother behind in France. He meets a French married couple with whom he develops a friendship, particularly with the wife. Moving into a share-apartment with other students he acquires a broader knowledge of women and life from his friends and their lives there. Not only learning more on Spanish politics and economy he develops his knowledge of the Spanish language. Does he find himself though? Cast includes Judith Godreche, Cecile De France, Kelly Reilly, Christina Brondo, Federico D’Anna, Barnaby Metschurat, Christian Pagh, Kevin Bishop, Xavier De Guillebon.

results.title: It's a very merry Muppet Christmas movie
results.creator_credit: Kirk Thatcher, Warren Carr, Martin G. Baker, Jim Henson, National Broadcasting Company and Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer
results.brief_description: It’s the night before Christmas and the Muppet Theatre is under threat of being demolished. Stars the usual Muppet gang of Miss Piggy, Kermit and others, who all rally and with some divine intervention and funny send-ups of holiday movie cliches, to reveal the film’s message is love will save the day (as well as a good song and dance number!). Humans that also feature are David Arquette, Joan Cusack and Whoopi Goldberg. Directed by Kirk R Thatcher and produced by Martin G Baker and Warren Carr.

results.title: The Day of the locust
results.creator_credit: John Schlesinger, Jerome Hellman, Long Road Productions and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: A scathing take on 1930s Hollywood motion picture industry, this film was only a moderate success at the time of release, despite garnering two Academy Award nominations. Adapted from Nathanael West’s novel the film principally charts the ambitions of Faye Greener (Karen Black), a talent-less starlet dreaming of fame, well beyond her grasp. In Faye’s orbit are Tod Hackett, a budding production designer and Homer Simpson, a wealthy suitor. Both men are driven mad by Faye’s excessive flirtations, yet stubborn unavailability. The narrative builds to a shocking climax. Music composed and conducted by John Barry.

results.title: Once upon a forest [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Charles Grosvenor, Jerry Mills, David Kirschner, HTV Cymbu Wales, Zotic Fox and Hanna-Barbera Productions
results.brief_description: Dapplewood is a magical place. One day three Furling friends, Abagail the wood mouse, Edgar the mole and Russell the hedgehog find their lives seriously disrupted. A chemical spill threatens Dapplewood and their young friend Michelle becomes seriously ill from the toxic fumes. The three friends use the skills they learned from their teacher Cornelius and embark on an exciting journey to find help for their friend. From the famous Hanna-Barbera studios.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Charles Grosvenor, Jerry Mills, David Kirschner, HTV Cymbu Wales, Zotic Fox and Hanna-Barbera Productions

results.title: The Duellists [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Ridley Scott, David Puttnam and Paramount Pictures
results.brief_description: In the early nineteenth century two officers in Napoleon’s army challenge each other to a duel. Their initial skirmish, which begins over a trivial insult, becomes a fierce and obsessive passion which dominates the lives of the men over thirty years. This beautifully photographed film is a penetrating study of the lunacy of war and the decay of the aristocratic class in Europe. The first feature by Ridley Scott, its ravishing imagery recalls the classicism of pictorial art of the period: the characters are framed in backgrounds that suggest Constable and Watteau. As the two men’s bitter feud enters its second decade, the images owe much to Turner and Delacroix. The rigid codes of pre-Napoleanic France are swept away by the romantic tide of revolution. With Harvey Keitel, Keith Carradine, Albert Finney and Tom Conti. Winner of Best Debut Film, Cannes, 1977. Based on Joseph Conrad’s short story. Also available on VHS [304321]

results.title: Sweet talker
results.creator_credit: Michael Jenkins, Ben Gannon, New Town Films and New Vision Films
results.brief_description: Con artist Harry Reynolds is released from prison armed with his partners research for a new scam. Harry heads for the dying town of Beachport near the coast of Australia where he cons the locals into investing big bucks into his scam (the recovery of an old ship and the building of a theme park). Complications arise when Harry falls for the local hotel owner Julie and her young son David. Cast includes: Bryan Brown, Karen Allen, Chris Haywood, Bill Kerr, Bruce Spence, Bruce Myles.
